channel.title: Portal Teleporting
channel.description:
How would I be able to get it when I click on a portal it teleports me to the specified coordinates?
This is what I currently have. [code] case 4388:
if (objectID == 4388) // Zamorak Choice client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player]; ppl.teleportToX = 3305; ppl.teleportToY = 2755; ppl.msgSend("You teleport to Train."); break; [/code]
I put that under [code] public static void objectClick [/code]
Right underneath [code] switch (objectID) { [/code]
And whenever I compile I get this error. [code] .\ObjectClick.java:12: not a statement client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Playe r]; ^ .\ObjectClick.java:12: ';' expected client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Playe r]; ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
I understand what the errors are, but I have no clue on how to fix them, so can someone please tell me what I need to do to get this fixed or what I did wrong.?
Btw:
This is the U-Rune Base by Kihomura in the objectClick class.
EDIT: Okay so I got it to compile correctly by changing it to
[code] How would I be able to get it when I click on a portal it teleports me to the specified coordinates?
This is what I currently have. [code] case 4388:
if (objectID == 4388) // Zamorak Choice c.teleportToX = 3305; c.teleportToY = 2755; c.msgSend("You teleport to Train."); break; [/code]
But now when I click on my portal nothing happens and I don't get a return message.[/code]

item.title: Portal Teleporting
item.dc:creator: @xPetrix xPetrix
item.description:
@xPetrix wrote:

How would I be able to get it when I click on a portal it teleports me to the specified coordinates?

This is what I currently have.

		case 4388:

		if (objectID == 4388) // Zamorak Choice
			client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];
			ppl.teleportToX = 3305;
			ppl.teleportToY = 2755;
			ppl.msgSend("You teleport to Train.");
		break;

I put that under

	public static void objectClick

Right underneath

switch (objectID) {

And whenever I compile I get this error.

.\ObjectClick.java:12: not a statement
                        client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Playe
r];
                        ^
.\ObjectClick.java:12: ';' expected
                        client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Playe
r];
                              ^
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

I understand what the errors are, but I have no clue on how to fix them, so can someone please tell me what I need to do to get this fixed or what I did wrong.?

Btw:

This is the U-Rune Base by Kihomura in the objectClick class.

EDIT: Okay so I got it to compile correctly by changing it to

[code]
How would I be able to get it when I click on a portal it teleports me to the specified coordinates?

This is what I currently have.

		case 4388:

		if (objectID == 4388) // Zamorak Choice
			c.teleportToX = 3305;
			c.teleportToY = 2755;
			c.msgSend("You teleport to Train.");
		break;

But now when I click on my portal nothing happens and I donâ€™t get a return message.[/code]
